titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lynn Porter-Bernadotte Papers WAG.360
titlestmt.author: Shiva Addanki

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:06:42 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: The Lynn Porter-Bernadotte Papers contain photographs, newspaper clippings, and legal documents related to Lynn Porter-Bernadotte's career in the New York City Fire Department. Porter-Bernadotte was one of the first women firefighters in New York City from 1982 to 2000.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Lynn Porter-Bernadotte in October 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.030

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lynn Porter-Bernadette was one of the first women firefighters in New York City. She served in the New York City Fire Department from 1982-2000.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Lynn Porter-Bernadotte Papers; WAG 360; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in an acid-free folder and box, and described on the collection-level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs, newspaper clippings, and legal materials related to Lynn Porter-Bernadotte's career in the New York City Fire Department.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Lynn Porter-Bernadotte, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in October 2018 by Lynn Porter-Bernadotte. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/
